website_summaries.verdict: A wide-encompassing WiFi setup, Eero offers coverage for larger homes needing excellent WiFi coverage.
pros: 3 independent Eero devices can be placed around the house for overlapping coverage
Installation for existing router setups is easy
cons: The individual Eero devices do not provide some of the advanced security features as normal routers

customer_reviews.title: $99 per year for Parental Control
customer_reviews.text: eero charges $99 per year for parental control when my old Netgear router does it for free. So instead of replacing my old Netgear router now I have to keep both. This is what I did: Plug in eero after Netgear. Turn on the bridge mode on eero and let Netgear handle the routing. Turn off the WiFi mode on Netgear so it is now just a wired router. Parental control should be free especially when the system costs $400! Why so greedy?
customer_reviews.author: Hung Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Unstable wifi it drops off constantly.
customer_reviews.text: When it works the eero is amazing but 7 months since the expensive purchase it constantly drops the internet connection. Once this happens you'll be the middle man to troubleshoot your problems. Eero support will blame your ISP, Modem, and Ethernet cable. After repeated calls and buying a new cable modem, calling the ISP and daily internet disconnections Eero will not stand by their product or warranty to get the unit replaced. You have to go through different levels of support to prove to get your unit replaced. Do yourself a favor and save your money and time and buy yourself a traditional wireless router and repeater. It's cheaper and more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Requires online account to use
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason, these devices require you to setup an online account before you can install and use them. I'm not a big fan of having to ask some external server for permission to use my network equipment :/
customer_reviews.author: Daniele Gaetano

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few hours
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it. Set-up was a breeze and I had all my devices on the new network within twenty minutes. It was improving my reach to the third floor, which is what I bought it for (though speed in the areas that were already OK seemed unimproved). Worked for several hours. Came back from dinner and entire system could not connect to internet even though internet was still coming through my modem and accessible through my old network. Spent ninety minutes with helpful tech on phone to no avail. Spent the money to make access easier, not a nightmare. Don’t know if unit was defective or if product as a whole is unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Rose

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Zero customer support!
customer_reviews.text: Eero worked for first 30 days. When free trial runs out it constantly drops out and is slow. Tech support won't email back at all! This is my 3rd attempt at leaving a review. Hopefully it's not censored like the last 2.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy & Tara Smith

customer_reviews.title: Consistently loses signal and stops working
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this system in 2 different homes and the results are just disappointing. WiFi is consistently spotty. It’ll work for a period of time and then just stop. No signal at all. This is despite having 2 base units and 2 additional beacons. In contrast, I have an old Apple unit that consistently works and is stronger (would have stayed with it but it was discontinued). I really wanted to like the Eero but it’s just not doing the job that it needs to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Miranda

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mesh system to improve my wifi speed in a 3 level, 5800 sq ft home. I had gigabit coming in from ATT and an ATT modem/router broadcasting wifi signal. I was using two wifi extenders in the home and only getting 15 mb download and 10 upload. After installing the eero pro mesh - I was pegging the speed meter all over the home - exceeding 200mbps download and upload. Super easy to install - using the iPhone app made it very easy and understandable. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Two units broke now won't offer refund
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this wifi device. When it works, it works well. But when it goes down it is really hard to get going again. My first unit broke after about 60 days. The second unit worked for 30 days. Customer service admits its a known issue and won't offer refund. I would not buy from Amazon as there is only 30 days return policy. I guess if you buy it, buy direct from them and maybe you will get a refund if it stops working. Really disappointed as Eero is actually owned by Amazon and I have been an Amazon customer since 2000.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN2000

customer_reviews.title: The BEST on the market today
customer_reviews.text: I read a LOT of reviews and did in depth research before purchasing the eero Pro system, and it really paid off! I bought the bundle of 3 eero Pro control stations (no beacons), and they work FANTASTIC. Super easy to install and configure. I used to have coverage issues using a router plus remote repeaters (complex install with multiple SSIDs). Now the signal in my house is full strength - everywhere, and I only have one SSID. This is a HUGE improvement, and I highly recommend the eero Pro to anyone with coverage issues. I truly believe this is currently the very best mesh system on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis VW

customer_reviews.title: AVOID EERO
customer_reviews.text: If I could get back my money, I would in a heartbeat. Big talk about eero and its mesh technology......it has slowed down my network, created issues with my Playstation Vue streaming service, caused me to purchase a switch for my cameras and remote thermostats, and more. There must be better products out there for true-mesh technology. Buy one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Broadway Bound

customer_reviews.title: You can't switch devices from 2.4 ghz to 5 ghz.
customer_reviews.text: This is something everyone needs to know before purchasing this product. I have a Dell gaming computer and it automatically connects to the 2.4 ghz. There is no way to pick the 5 ghz. I only get 62 mps. In the same room, I have a Dell laptop that connects to the 5 ghz automatically and it gets 452 mps. After contacting support I was told there is no way to change this. This is unacceptable. I am returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: Buy The New Eero
customer_reviews.text: It arrived about a week ago but I just hooked it up today because I was afraid I would screw it up. Mechanically I'm not good. But it was unbelievably easy to hook up the main and the two additional unitsI. Full bars across iPad everywhere in the house. And I'm sitting in my outdoor gazebo writing this review. This product is unbelievable so far. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: For nearly $500 purchased NEW, not working right out of box- NOT COOL
customer_reviews.text: You'd think that for paying half a grand for a new WIFI mesh router system that you'd be getting a quality NEW product. Instead I get a box of three (scratched up) eero modules missing cables (obviously used but sold brand new)....this was NOT cool.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Does not support PPPOE
customer_reviews.text: If your ISP uses PPPOE the eero will not work without putting it behind a router with the wireless turned off. This means another piece of equipment plus it negates some of the features of the eero. DO NOT BUY if you have PPPOE. Now I have to decide whether I return this stuff or what!
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: No PPPOE authentication ! ? Really EERO?
customer_reviews.text: You know what this means? if your internet connection requires you to enter username and password, as tons of internet service providers do, YOU WON'T BE ABLE TO USE YOUR $500 'most awesome wifi product' .. period. end of the line.. I researched it and came to find out failed and upset customers asking for this feature for YEARS ! No PPPOE ?? I mean this is just nuts !! its such tiny but not TINY feature, yet its not there and seems like won't be there.. If I known would I bought it. NO SIR ! .. I still have to use my old router behind modem as BRAIN and eero's are just an antenna. would not needed.. Sorry..
customer_reviews.author: P. User

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - but Google Wifi is faster
customer_reviews.text: I ordered both Eero and Google Wifi to see which system provided the best and fastest coverage for my 3600 sq ft home made mostly of cinder block. Eero was easier to set up because it just plugs into the wall, but in the most challenging locations in my home Eero only provided 43MB/sec download speeds, compared to Google Wifi which provided 90+MB/sec download speeds. The devices and the wifi points were in the same positions. Because Google was faster (and $150 cheaper), I returned Eero.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem to work with Alexa devices
customer_reviews.text: While the Eero devices seem to work fine for a WiFi network, I have (after over a week) been able to connect my echo dot devices to the new network. I spent 45 minutes with Eero technical support but he finally said he couldn't find a solution. After hours, I did manage to connect one echo dot to the network, but have been unable to connect the other three. None of the instructions I have found online work. If you have Alexa devices do NOT buy unless you want to throw the Alexa devices in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Doug E.

customer_reviews.title: Overheats easily
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it was great. Unfortunately it didn't work consistently nor for very long. The main Eero unit would get too hot to touch and drop off the network. I would have to unplug it and let it cool down. THis pattern repeated constantly so I ended up returning the whole thing. I will give Eero an A+ for design..the units themselves are beautiful and sleek...but they just don't function.
customer_reviews.author: L. Clegg

customer_reviews.title: Samsung users take note...
customer_reviews.text: Samsung Note 10+ EDITED: This is 100% trash support. Never got passed "Checking Internet Connection," And Spent 45 minutes on the phone with their tech support. Solution? "You must have received a broken near $500 usd piece of equipment... you'll need to do an exchange to fix it. NAH. IM GOOD. I'll go buy one that works. <I KEPT AT IT> Edit... I got it working. It was my phone somehow but my wife's iPhone worked perfectly. EQUIPMENT WISE: I'd give it 4 to 5 stars easily... but not catching something that mundane and ONLY making me repeat syeps I'd been doing according to their web site. Super great modem. Crap tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Schiller

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Amazon Smart Plugs
customer_reviews.text: Update: Have spent 30 min on hold twice trying to get Eero to figure it out... Just listening to their wait music... Uggh. Can I give Eeero negative stars? How in the world is it that eero (an Amazon company) can't get Amazon Smart Plugs to work on it? My amazon smart plug works great on non-Eero networks... and my TP-Link plug works great on Eero, but for some reason, Amazon Smart Plugs don't work on eero. This is a real shame and should be an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: KCK

customer_reviews.title: You don’t get basic content blocking unless you pay $100/year. BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s totally bogus that after paying $500 for the pro system, Eero wants you to pay $100 per year so you can block adult internet content from your children’s devices. Because of that I am giving this 1 star. Because company’s have to learn that picking our pockets for basic features won’t be given a good rating
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Does not have a seperate 2.4GHZ WiFi band for adding 2.4GHZ WiFi devices
customer_reviews.text: EERO technical support knows this problem with older devices that only intially connect to 2.4GHZ WiFi wireless band. EERO support can turn off temporally the 5GHZ band to allow you to add your 2.4GHZ WiFi device and the turn the 5GHZ band back on, but this is real pain as you must call thier support evey time. It now been 3 Months and I have called the support 5 times: 3 to add 2.4GHZ devices and now buffering problems on Netflix ans Amazon, and now I have lost my port forwarding to my Media and Survalance system from the WAN (www side) and still has not been solved, Work for 3 Months and glad it has a 1 Year Warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Chester Makowski

customer_reviews.title: Extremely unreliable connectivity. WiFi Coverage doesn't matter if the gateway can't connect to the internet.
customer_reviews.text: Network has gone down at least 4-5 times per week since owning. Customer support goes through very basic troubleshooting but we have not arrived at a solution. I have had this network fail to connect to the internet completely more times in a few months than the entirety of my wireless internet usage over the last decade. I expected more of this product.
customer_reviews.author: webpablo

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Install
customer_reviews.text: Well, this installation certainly took much longer than the advertised 10 minutes. It took well over an hour. I bought the three-pack of Pros, because I live in a large modern house. For some reason, each of the three devices needed to be installed at least twice. Sometimes 3 or 4 times. For example, it would do a "placement test" which would fail. Then, without changing anything, I would run the placement test again, and, not only would it pass, it would say that the placement is excellent. The user interface is weak. You have to do everything in sequence, and you can't skip anything. At any rate it's working now, but I wouldn't recommend this device to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Apple users beware!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I’d read the reviews BEFORE I purchased this item, then I wouldn’t have waited past my return date to call for support, nor would I be stuck with a $$$ item that is utterly useless. If you are an APPLE product user, especially iPhone (iOS) and Apple TV, do not buy this. There are issues upon issues upon issues - the primary one being disconnected signals, inability to connect to multiple (or even only one) devices because of “signal strength”. I’ve tried calling for support but after explaining what was going on, and then being hung up on, I am well and truly furious. Avoid this headache and just don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Richmond

customer_reviews.title: 100% Worth it
customer_reviews.text: My home is 7,000 sq. ft. Mediterranean concrete stucco structure. We have struggled with WiFi coverage for years. Then the college twins came home due to Covid and our system just could not handle the needs. I tried extenders (ugh). I tapped into my IT brain (non-existent) then while using my spotty dysfunctional WiFi i stumbled upon eeros. Now my college sophomore twins can actually complete online tests, upload course work, and all the while I can do my online shopping with Amazon. Win-Win!
customer_reviews.author: April in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Wifi Simplified and Amplified
customer_reviews.text: I'm a techie from way back, I mean the '70s. We had LAN and Wifi, hard to configure and s-l-o-w. Eero has made it simple and easy, even for the non-teckies. I live in a old, 1860s multi-story, red-brick (high metal content), with mirrors on lots of the walls; not friendly to WiFi signals. I have a combination of wired and meshed Eeros. I have no dead-zones. I definitely like these, especially the simplified setup. Tech Support is great too. Nothing is perfect. I had a unit that was misbehaving and would not allow my Withing scale to connect. I worked with Tech Support and was able to get unit functional again. I recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a WiFi mesh that works and is super simple
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly everywhere in 3 story house. Super easy to install. 40+ devices with 7 of us running multiple devices and all the IoT gadgets. So nice not to get texts at work or while traveling that the internet is down again or kids using cellular data because the signal isn’t adequate in their bedroom. Returned Google WiFi mesh after a few weeks as it didn’t provide the needed coverage and would go out to lunch several times a day where the throughout went to a crawl and a reset was required. Eero is worth the extra money as it is simple and works.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Scadden

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival: Bad Quality Assurance
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pack of 3 Eero pros. The first two setup without any issue. The third was dead on arrival. From 2 feet away, it can't connect even. The device can't even be hard reset. It's a brick. I shouldn't receive a brick in a brand new package.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Expensive. Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Expensive. About twice as much as a other high end routers. They advertise excellent coverage and quick, easy set up. It’s anything but easy and definitely not quick. First, download an app, second create an account that involves providing your personal information. Verify your email. WTF? Why can’t I just use your product? Nope. Tech support? Better call before 5pm or it’s just too bad. Only way to interact with the device is through the app. Pain in the neck. Save your money, buy a cheaper router and avoid the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Sam O'Toole

customer_reviews.title: Improvement over Airport network
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a 2015-era Apple Airport Extreme network with two nodes. We have a long house and it was tricky to get coverage from one end to the other. Over the last several months I was having reliability issues. Eero set-up was very easy with the phone app. I am consistently getting 45-50 Mbps on the eero Beacon units in places where I was getting a spotty 5-10 Mbps before. I'm glad I bit the bullet and purchased. The only thing to note is you will need an ethernet switch if you have multiple devices with wired network connections; the eero only has 2 ethernet ports (1 of which is for your modem).
customer_reviews.author: D. E. West

customer_reviews.title: So Much Better Than Orbi
customer_reviews.text: Have used a variety of WiFi systems over the years. Most recently, we were using Orbi, but were plagued with constant signal drops, device reboots, and issues that happened intermittently throughout the day. After troubleshooting the Orbi settings, dealing with our ISP support, and trying to optimize settings/setup within the home, we finally gave up and purchased this Eero system. It was super easy to setup, provides a consistently strong signal and coverage throughout the home, and has a very user friendly interface. Highly recommend this to others who may also be experiencing the same types of issues with other mesh devices.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene O.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Once we got the system up and working, it solved all our problems. Thanks to Covid, we have a houseful of people working from home. Our router couldn't handle all our equipment anymore. These devices manage everything perfectly. We've had no Wi-Fi drops since we installed the system. It's peaceful here again. My only complaint is that the instructions that came with it were too simplistic and there was actually another step that we needed to do which I found right away on the eero web site. No big deal, just wasted some time - which we all have lots of lately. It was expensive, but worth it to keep everyone working.
customer_reviews.author: Designer MomTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Still the Best Mesh Setup on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2200 sq foot home with about 50 wireless devices. Many wyze cams, smart home devices and streaming appliances such as Roku. After constant issues with my 3 node Velop system I decided to move to Eero. What a difference. All of my devices stay connected and I can view several wyze cams at once which the velop just couldn't handle. Devices actually connect to the closer Eero unit instead of randomly connecting to whatever node it felt like. Bummed I spent nearly 2 years accepting constant issues with Velop when this eero setup (3 eero pros) was available all along. Best upgrade I have ever made since wifi is so important to my tech footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Lindstrom

customer_reviews.title: JUNK JUNK JUNK JUNK JUNK. DO NOT BUY  and EERO is owned by AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: If it does not work right away you are in trouble. EERO will string you on provide terrible tech support make excuses until you cannot send it back. The short return window ensures it will never be returned. Long time Amazon Customer and between EERO (an Amazon Product) and Amazon they have disappointed more for the first time with the runaround. Based on my experience the EERO is not worth it. Amazon knows it but they invested a lot of $$$ in a poor product.
customer_reviews.author: CAPT T. RUBENSTEIN

customer_reviews.title: Stop worrying about your wifi network
customer_reviews.text: The eero installation went smoothly and in less than 30 minutes. The three unit package covers my property very well and is much more stable than the last system I had that used plug-in beacons. The eero app gives you full control as well as info on which devices are currently connected (as well as devices that have recently been connected) and the signal strength for each. Right now I have eight devices connected with no sign of slowing speeds. The beacons are attractively designed and have an optional "nightlight" which shines downward in a darkened room. I'm very happy with this purchase... and now I can stop worrying about my wifi network.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost a Top of Class Item
customer_reviews.text: Would have given them 5 Stars as their Product is That Great! However, their Tech Support line sucks. A VERY LONG wait. No call back, just hold. And hold. And hold. However, once the Support Person gets on, they make you forget about the long wait (almost) as they are SO GOOD. They know their product and they know their user - unlike their Web Tech who apparently knows NOTHING about what a User does. Or Needs. Or knows how to go about getting it without being WebTech Minded. A sharp looking site with nothing useful to click on when you have something in mind that you would like - or need.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Computer Tech

customer_reviews.title: I have owned Google, Apple, and many more!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned them all for years. If you need wifi calling this is the BEST experience imaginable. Setup in 5 minutes and unlike my google nightmares its just works. All phones making outbound calls and even txt to non ATT customers working instantly! FINALLY something that works. PS. 2X speeds that my apple routers too. Google was fast but did not support WIFI calling without manual ports that NEVER WORKED! 3 of my employees and 2 neighbors with no phone service are now using these and LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Gusto

customer_reviews.title: 10 minutes install!?!?  I've been at it FOUR HOURS and still not up and running.
customer_reviews.text: I'll never know whether this would have worked or not because I can't get it to install. Yes, the instructions read as if they are "simple", but it just doesn't work. It doesn't connect. Whether I need to get Spectrum involved so that I have a different kind of modem, or whatever the problem might be, it isn't spoken of when selling the product. Support is offered only by phone and only during work hours--NO CHAT is offered. SHAME ON SELLER. $550 later and I'm furious and exhausted. POTENTIAL BUYERS, save yourselves the emotional upset and trouble of returning.
customer_reviews.author: DaleS

customer_reviews.title: NOT an improvement!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this set for three months. No dramatic changes in speed, in fact, speeds have been lower and my Wi-Fi constantly drops. I'm going to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Love the control over the internet and great wireless
customer_reviews.text: I have a few family members that spend too much time online. This helps limit them while still handling a somewhat smart home. I have many devices connect constantly. The wireless is good enough to game on. We've only used one gaming computer wireless at a time and it worked great. I use the family profiles and schedules constantly and can run checks to find out what is going on with a device very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Josie Young

customer_reviews.title: Eero Pro Has Changed Our Family
customer_reviews.text: My only regret is not buying a mesh system earlier. Eero makes our Internet available (and fast) everywhere in our five bedroom house and even out in the backyard and down the driveway. The kids are so happy. They can all stream their YouTube videos and play their PS4 at the same time. It's easy to install. Easy to use. I just can say enough good things.
customer_reviews.author: JakeMom

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work - Constantly goes Offline
customer_reviews.text: I returned my Eero system to Amazon today because it just did not work. As others have stated in review, it would constantly go offline. And I do mean constantly. Easy to install. Tech support is good as far as timely response and trying to solve the problem, but after four days of trying with no improvement I had to give up.
customer_reviews.author: mman

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: After replacing less expensive routers every 3-4 months, I knew I had to do something different. I conducted research and found this one had the best reviews and decided it to try it. We have enjoyed uninterrupted internet connection using this system. We have the one big router and two extenders and they have worked perfectly in our 2500 square foot home. WE LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Mays

customer_reviews.title: Glad I made the switch to eero
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy installation process. Excellent wifi coverage for my 2,300 single story home. By far, the eero system provided better and more uniform wifi reception throughout my house in contrast to the high performance Netgear gaming routers that I use to have. I had to replace them because of the constant hassle and cumbersome software update process plus their spotty wifi reception, despite adding range extenders. Given the configuration of my home, they simply did not stand up to the performance of the eero that I just installed. Simply put, I’m very pleased that I made the switch over to eero.
customer_reviews.author: Y3A3

customer_reviews.title: 100% satisfied. Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Woah, this is exactly was i was looking for. I had one modem and 2 routers to control 50+ devices and i still had slow internet connection. Now with the eero pro my problem is solved. What i like The most is the fact that i only use one wifi name and no matter where im located in the house eero automatically select the best connection. By the way, mi internet speed is now what i pay for. No more slow internet. I have 54 devices connected to my wifi network, that includes surveillance cameras and smart bulbs. Now my smart home is fully operational thanks to eero pro wifi system.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Blandford

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Item
customer_reviews.text: I had tried everything for my cameras yo connect to the WiFi and nothing worked. I was at my wits end and I heard about the eero routers. These things are truly a Godsend. They’re a little pricey but well worth the money. With all of the other items that I purchased, I would have saved a lot had I gotten these first. Just get yourself a strong modem to go with these routers and you’re all set. They are very easy to set up. They walk you through it step by step. I’m not tech savvy and I did it so that’s saying a lot. Try them. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The system replaced the Apple airport and 2 extenders and the coverage is extremely better. Our home is 2000 sq ft and stone all the way around. We have outside cameras that use WiFi and they are working much better with the eeros. No lose of signal anywhere around the entire house. Easy to set up in less than 10 minutes. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: Wide coverage and fast everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Plus: I have a 3000 sq ft home and this mesh wifi system covers it perfectly, everywhere. We have at least 50 wifi devices, including phones, tablets, computers, 2 set-top streaming devices, several Echos, a Google Home device, lots of light swithces, a Roomba, a printer, 4 wifi cameras, an oven, and other devices, and they all connect perfectly, with a WiFi speed that is vastly superior (by an order of magnitude) than what we had with our previous, standard wifi router. I'd love it if the router could be controlled using a web browser, but the phone app works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Terrible support and product does not live up to promises
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 3 device eero system less than 1 year ago. It began having speed and signal issues within 3 months. The original issues were resolved. About 3-4 months later the same issues reappeared. They are constantly doing updates, which may have been the reason behind reoccurring issues. Support started out great, but has since taken a steep DECLINE. Support asks the same questions over and over and over, and never does anything. The latest support rep even stopped replying to email. I bought this product because it states that my speeds will be consistent and no drop off from the subscribed speeds I pay for, anywhere in my home. That is NOT the case.
customer_reviews.author: Ksmoo

customer_reviews.title: Too much if it doesn’t all work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product In April and it is now June. The home box and 1 of the smaller boxes work but the other small box stopped working around the 1 month mark. Unfortunately I didn’t get to return it before the window for a return closed. I wish that everything worked seamlessly but unfortunately for me that just hasn’t been the case.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie G Canady

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t for me
customer_reviews.text: I really thought this was going to change our WiFi for the better.... however it was actually slower than our Nighthawk and more expensive for the home system. It did improve our speed in our basement, but the rest of the house suffered immensely. I’m outside the return window so im stuck with it for the time being. Will probably resell price give to a family member as a gift. My advice would be to look elsewhere, since purchasing and discussing with friends many of them recommend going with Google.
customer_reviews.author: Angus

customer_reviews.title: Sanity Saver.
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure: I am not a very technical person when it comes to networks and such, but I like my internet fast. I work remotely so lots of slack video calls, downloading big files, etc in my life and though we are paying Comcast roughly $1M every month for 1G internet, the signal in my home office was dropping about every 5 minutes and quickly eroding my sanity. If I moved two rooms over to be closer to the Comcast-provided router everything, including my sanity, worked perfectly. Enter Eero. Setup was simple and it.just.works. I'm finally getting the speed I'm paying for and most importantly, no more dropped wifi!! Miracle of miracles.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wright

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need
customer_reviews.text: I moved from a small house in a large city (where high-speed Internet was fairly easy to arrange) to a large house in the middle of nowhere. I need Internet access for both work and leisure, for web-conferencing and entertainment. The only high-speed option in this area is satellite, and while it covered a large part of the house, it didn't extend outside at all, and not at all to the outer buildings or yard. The eero mesh network that we set up means we have high-speed wi-fi everywhere; inside and outside the house. The web app was a breeze to set up. I love how easy it was to set up a guest network and password.
customer_reviews.author: clynch

customer_reviews.title: Best System Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase all year! Well worth every penny! I work from home, as an IT Project Manager and typically have back-to-back conference calls, which usually drop several times through each call. Upgraded internet speeds several times with AT&T U-verse, with little to no success each time. Received the system installed per instructions and within 20 minutes, my home (over 3400 sf) was blanketed with reliable wi-if! No more dropped calls. No more buffering. The Amazon Firestick works now. Apple TV works better and the Streaming devices in the media room finally work without a wired connection. Setup was easy-peasy. The cute little night lights are a bonus! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Ridiculous wait times for support
customer_reviews.text: Update to my review...On the third attempt I finally got through to tech support (1st and 2nd time waited on hold for 1hr 30mins before hanging up). The estimated wait time was 4mins. It took 45mins before I got a human to help. Once he got on he was FANTASTIC. He was patient, and spent 40 mins walking through the challenges I was having. It was my router/modem, not the Eeros. Since I have gotten it up and running, it has been really good. WIFI signal is strong. We have multiple devices running at once, and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: MH123

customer_reviews.title: Loving the eero Pro Mesh
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying for years to get good WiFi services in my home. I have had no less than 5 Access Points in 14 years to no avail until now. I am very happy with the performance of the eero Pro. I now have service throughout my home with no interruption. I have to say the setup was extremely simple, but I had to get used to the lack of setup options other than through the app. Don't get me wrong, the app is an outstanding tool, I just have a tech background and can't help tweaking things.
customer_reviews.author: Telcomspec

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!!!  Love my new eero Pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Eero system to replace my aging Apple Time Capsule router. I downloaded the app on my iPhone and getting the system up and running was very easy. The app guides through step by step. I had everything up and running in 20 minutes. The system then did a software update and that took about 10 minutes and that was it. Really easy. So far it has been flawless and my signal strength is way, way better all through our house. Even have wifi in the detached garage and out to the street. I highly recommend eero!
customer_reviews.author: Louise K.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Magic Home and cannot turn off 5Ghz
customer_reviews.text: If you have LED strip lights that use the Magic Home Pro app for configuration, beware that you will not be able to use them with Eero. Eero tries to connect everything on the 5Ghz band and there is no way to disable that feature to force usage of the 2.4Ghz band. Magic Home (and many other apps) will only work on 2.4Ghz.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: 10X improvement over Ubiquity
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Ubiquiti (Ubiquiti Networks UniFi AP Enterprise WiFi System UAP-3) system with a similar setup, one Ethernet connected node and two wireless. I placed EERO in the same spots. However, Ubiquiti nodes were closer to the ceiling, and EERO down below in outlets. So, EERO, technically, was at a disadvantage. Then I remeasured speed from the same, the most remote spot in the house. I got 10x speed improvement. See the screenshot. Perfect connection to my appliances in a detached garage 15 yards away from the house as well. Expensive, but it’s truly remarkable performance. Setup was very smooth. I haven’t played with advanced management features yet.
customer_reviews.author: P. Berenberg

customer_reviews.title: Product heats up and stops working.
customer_reviews.text: This product becomes really hot and stops functioning. Product support is not much help. Keeps asking me to reset and does not want to replace product. Cant waste any more time on it so its sitting there and not being used. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy Setup - Reliable System
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every variant of extender and setup for a 4,200 SQFT home and developed a healthy dose of skepticism about whether there was a well integrated, wireless solution that would reliably work. I have had the eero system up and running for a couple of weeks and can now readily say that this was worth the expense. The system was extraordinarily easy to set up and install. Literally ten minutes! It has worked reliably for these two weeks, with strong signals across all areas that were previously dead zones in the house. No more complaints from anyone on speed or reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Take it from an IT Professional...
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best mesh wireless system for residences. Easy to use, clean styling, and even has night lights built in if you want to use them. Throughput is decent. These units automatically update themselves with eero's latest firmware. The control software for iOS or Android is simple to use. It is also easy to grow the mesh, just add a new beacon, open the app, and the setup is a breeze. I've used almost every brand of router, wired/wireless, AP...and these for a residential application are solid investment. I have been very satisfied, actually, exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: punk0mi

customer_reviews.title: strong signal but limited dashboard
customer_reviews.text: it works pretty fast right out of the box, but with 2 issues. The beacons don't work until their firmware is updated. So get the beacons set up in the same room as the main Eero pro base station router, update the firmware, then move it to where you want to extend the signal. Eero needs a way to turn off the 5g so it is easy to connect home smart devices like cameras that get confused when 5g and 2.4 use the same network name. Simplisafe cameras are a hassle with Eero.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Zonvil

customer_reviews.title: Mother Of All Mesh Wifi
customer_reviews.text: This product is expensive. I cannot justify price. But of all the mesh wifi systems I have attempted to buy/try google, ausus Lyra, netgear orbi, plume, m5deco tplink, the eero turn out to be AMAZING I couldn't believe it was real. I have the 3pack one wired from my router and the other two wireless and have the same speed from anyone of eeros I am standing by amazing all through the home it's all 5ghz band that I am connecting and getting same speed from like I am at my cable modem. I still don't believe while typing still thinking its a one off. Not real
customer_reviews.author: DaffyDuck

customer_reviews.title: On the verge of sending it back
customer_reviews.text: Despite promises of “only minutes to install,” I have literally already spent an hour and the app won’t install and nobody answers the tech support line. It’s not much good if I can’t even set it up.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fishbein

customer_reviews.title: Better than Orbi
customer_reviews.text: We've had eero for about a month, and so far it is rock solid. We had a single ac1900 router before that couldn't keep up with our increasing number of connected devices, and didn't allow full coverage of our home (3,500 sqft, two levels). First we tried Netgear Orbi, and while setup and coverage we're good, it also had trouble with the number of devices connected, resulting in choppy video and music streaming. We returned Orbi and tried eero next, and it's been awesome. Strong signal and full coverage, no issues with number of devices, and super easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Dan R

customer_reviews.title: Works as needed
customer_reviews.text: Had coverage gaps in my house which was causing my usage with my mobile providers to spike when using my phones at home. Ever since I installed my Eero units, coverage gaps have disappeared and my mobile bill is more in line with what it should be. Got three units - I used internal house Cat 5 wiring to tie the Eero's together. Speed is maintained even in the farthest reaches of my home. Really like the app and security features which gives me even more visibility into what is going on with my home network. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dalaisama

customer_reviews.title: Fairly plug-n-play by lacking some decision metrics and DNS features
customer_reviews.text: Fairly nice plug-n-play WiFi repeaters. Small extenders just sit in outlets around the house and do their job mostly well. There’s this odd thing where my devices are connected to not-the-closest AP or repeater, but maybe there’s interference between me and the closest, and maybe there’s not enough interference or degraded throughout to cause the devices to migrate to another device. ...related: device migration decisions/metrics are not openly shared. IGD interface is bogus, needs fixing on my revision. No dnsmasq-like automatic PTR/A records populated from DHCP leases (I got used to this with 10-yr-old WRTs, and UBNT UNMS with “dns server” customized)
customer_reviews.author: Allan Clark

customer_reviews.title: App needs a lot of work
customer_reviews.text: The app will continually tell you "everything's fine" in green letters when your internet is down. Everything IS fine in the LAN, which is the communication between the Eeros. It's just you have no Internet service. It should alert you when your provider goes down (via pop-up) so you can do something about it before having to figure it out by yourself. If you run a speediest it will discover the WAN is down. But no alert or understanding that "Everything is FINE" when your provider is down.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: The One, The Only.....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the original eero system before they were even shipping for our house to make sure my boss(wife) got a strong WiFi signal at the far reaches of our sprawling house. When the second iteration was produced, I modified my system with those. We are pleased no end to the eero system. When my daughter and her husband bought a townhouse, I bought them an eero system, which they love. Eero customer support is quick and responsive. Whenever I had a question, they answered quickly and accurately in hours, not days. The interface is ridiculously simple to use with set-up from scratch in minutes. I would recommend eero plus as an add on. Almost like a firewall of protection.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Bevitz

customer_reviews.title: Wow, strong WiFi and very good interface app.
customer_reviews.text: My 3500 sq ft, 100 year old home was a nightmare for all my previous expensive routers. Plaster and lathe walls and ceilings, brick exterior, two-story plus basement. This system works. AND it is strong enough to reach not just my detached garage and the wireless cams and door openers in it, but also reaches past that to my neighbors' home. They're elderly and I let them use my WiFi for their phone. We have 24 connections so far, including security cameras, thermostats, laptops, TVs, fire sticks, game console, phones, printers, doorbell, pellet grill, home "hubs", you name it. Everything works without issue. Love this! Finally the promise of WiFi throughout the whole property has come true.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Replace Your Five Year Old WiFi Router Now!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup. It replaced a 6+ year old D-Link router and I experienced a WiFi coverage paradigm shift. In addition to seamless connectivity inside, now also have excellent outside patio connectivity. The only disappointment was Eero tech support’s failure to acknowledge the existence of an app bug - when as it turned out was already widely noted on Reddit. The bug has since been fixed with an update, and tech support did email me several weeks later to advise that it was available - but I spend way too much time trying to solve a problem which Eero knew existed but did not own up to.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Random lockups, no internet
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these, and I do, but they suffer from a few defects that really need to be addressed. First, they randomly lock up requiring a power disconnect and reconnect to get them reconnected again. Second, they randomly stop connecting to the internet either without any cause or after an internet issue with cable. It's disappointing that in 2020 we get buggy firmware like this in a major product. They definitely have some issues that need to be addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Provencher

customer_reviews.title: Underperforming when compared to Velop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Luma, eero and Velop. Eero was the worst of the 3. I had to complete the installation 2 times before the 3 units worked together, it did not provide coverage to the yard and had troubles recognizing appropriately what was connected to the network. Luma had similar issues but provided better coverage in the back yard (with 5 luma units installed). Velop provided the best coverage even though the list of devices connected to the network is still wrong most of the time
customer_reviews.author: jladamo

customer_reviews.title: My Best WiFi Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps the best WiFi purchase I have ever made. Reception problems plagued me for years.The eero pro mesh system solved my WiFi reception problems in my three story brownstone immediately. Amazon tech support installed system for us and they were wonderful. I wish I could give this product six stars
customer_reviews.author: Vince T

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing
customer_reviews.text: I set this up for my 2200 square foot house. I also have a small, separated guest room about 200 feet away from my house (that always had poor signal). I also have Charter Spectrum, this is a sham monopoly company that charges a bunch and gives you as little as possible. They finally admitted to me that they only guarantee a certain speed to the house... their equipment lets a fraction of it through. This system seems to have fixed the problem. I now have blanketed Wi-Fi over my entire property of 3/4 acre. Would recommend. I am not a tech guru and couldn't tell you the differences between routers, modems and whatever... but this product works.
customer_reviews.author: BulletProof

customer_reviews.title: poor coverage
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up the system expecting great results. No problems in setup. noticed immediately that my tv in kitchen was experiencing buffering with a poor signal. poor signal in spots throughout the house with the best signal in the bedroom on the top floor. Had a friend in IT come over to trouble shoot and his equipment found what I was seeing. Kodak Printer in home office would not hook up while the HP printer had intermittent connectivity issues. Not worth the hassle - packed up and shipped back. Hooked up old nighthawk (R7000) router - printers now work and wifi is back to "normal". Wanted better wifi coverage is why i tried these but not worth the extra money
customer_reviews.author: Jt's thought

customer_reviews.title: Super high speed mesh network
customer_reviews.text: I installed this mesh network in my home. I installed the main router in my basement and the two relays in the upper two floors of my home. The phone app worked perfectly and was easy to use. My wireless network speed increased from 15 Mbps to 70 Mbps (no exaggeration) everywhere in my house. The app works well and is easy to access and understand. This 3-unit set is a bit expensive, but it's easy to install and works great right out of the box. I have no complaints whatsoever. 5 stars all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Some Random Guy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t support Giga Speeds
customer_reviews.text: It works well in maintaining a stable connection in a 1,600 sf 2 story home. However do not buy if you’re expecting gigabit speeds through WiFi. Best I get is around 400-500 download on wireless. The Eero app shows close to 800-900 but that’s not what you’re actually getting as the Eero tests the speed to the actual modem. I just ended up using an Ethernet cable to my computer to get the speed I’m paying for. For general use like watching streaming TV, it’s fine I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Signal boosting great; some technical issues if using a VPN systemt
customer_reviews.text: The signal boost is great. I can go to the border of our backyard and still get signal! Helps me with online exercise and dog training classes. Only issue is using my company’s VPN system. The eero “fights” with the xfinity router to give the VPN an IP address. Tried calling eero tech support, but they said I had to have xfinity make the router a bridge. Xfinity not very cooperative as its not their system. Had to hardwire my computer to the router to get it to connect into our company servers. I am not a tech savvy person, so this was a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Sheela M.

customer_reviews.title: It's not until you need them that you remember things like your thermostat and scale need the fracking internet
customer_reviews.text: We added this to our home to try to speed up all of our connections including work from home computers. After a few weeks everything is working well and we have had no problems with connections or speed. Of course, changing WiFi is a tumultuous project when trying to remember all of the things that you have attached to Wifi. It's not until you need them that you remember things like your thermostat and scale need the fracking internet. What kind of a world do we live in where your scale needs the internet. Now forever the interwebs will know I weighed 212 pounds after eating $20 worth of Burger King. I'm not ashamed though.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Roth

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect , easy set up, super fast WiFi now.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I did my research as I just installed 3 pro eero and getting 200 Mgs now instead of just 35 with my Apple Extreme. Remember to set in bridge mode if you have FIOS router like I do. I called their service line and they helped me in 5 min. This product and company is a winner. I read reviews and choose stability and service over perhaps more speed with Orbi. Make the right choice and buy this if you are replacing Apple Extreme.
customer_reviews.author: ProducerNYC

customer_reviews.title: Installation is quite a pain. Once installed works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: - Didn't realize that installation procedure requires your phone be connected to the internet over mobile network. I have barely 1 bar of coverage. The device registration procedure timed out on me sever times. - The bluetooth pairing din't work on my Galaxy S8. Had to type the serial number manually. The number is quite long with 0 not being so different from O very prone to typing errors. My few suggestions would be: - Add fully offline setup procedure (including access to help). - Add the QR code to scan instead of having users type S/N.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This system just works, no messing around
customer_reviews.text: My home network coverage used to be terrible as my cable modem and router was located in a corner of the house on the bottom floor, due to the location of the cable. Now I get full coverage on the top floor at the other side of the house. The only bottleneck now is the actual cable modem - if only that thing could monitor and fix itself too.
customer_reviews.author: RectusRat

customer_reviews.title: From and Non-Techy... I LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy and fast set up. Three bedroom ranch completely covered with no dead spots, including the basement, and zero interruptions. Identified all devices easily and connection was done in literally minutes. Love this system. I'm not a techy person, so I can't give you all the specs, but I have a desktop, two laptops, two cell phones, an HDTV and a 4K TV with TIVO connected to it along with two dots and my Kindle Fire. Never an issue with any of the above. I never even think about it as it just works beautifully. Would highly recommend this over any non-mesh systems. I haven't tried other mesh wi-fi systems, but why bother. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Janet K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: It fixed my dead spots around the house. I ...
customer_reviews.text: It fixed my dead spots around the house. I have a 3000 sqft house with a 7000 sqft lot. This gets everything in the house and adequate service at the farthest part of the yard. I did get a 4th to add extra distance in the garage so my Ring Floodlight worked more consistently. I have 2 Nest thermostats, 2 nest cams, a ring doorbell, 2 iPhones, 2 iPads, a ring floodlight, 3 TV's, and an iMac connected with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Andre L.

customer_reviews.title: We now get the wifi speeds we pay!
customer_reviews.text: Eero was recommended to me by a network engineer friend. We were paying for 150/150 FIOS internet but we weren't getting the speeds with the router that came with the service. I didn't want to spend the money so I purchased Orbi at a local wholesale club. Needless to say, it did work any better then my router. I finally purchased Eero and have been extremely happy ever since. Extremely easy setup and it is a work horse.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Filled the gaps in my coverage
customer_reviews.text: I live in an older building that seems to block my wifi. I bought this to replace my Apple Airport Extreme and two Time Capsules I was using to extend the range. I was getting great bandwidth between my living room and first bedroom with the old setup, but the second bedroom was much slower and frequently lost signal. I also didnt have good signal in the kitchen. The eero isn’t as fast as that first bedroom connection (150-200 mbps vs 700+ mbps) but I am now getting consistent 150-200 mbps throughout my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Wow...  just wow
customer_reviews.text: It took me 10 minutes to install the system, much of which was spend rewiring a network switch to ensure it was on the same Intranet as the wifi. The eero system replaced a Spectrum supplied wifi router that - standing next to it - maxed out wifi at 15 mbps (from an advertised source Ethernet capacity of 100 mbps). A third of the house was in wifi shadow. With the eero system running the entire house and the yard (.4 acre) has 5 bars. The Spectrum speed test shows 115 mbps. Fantastic
customer_reviews.author: sysalo

customer_reviews.title: Great router setup!
customer_reviews.text: Really great router setup. The big thing is ease of use and convenience. Before buying this, I had a second router hard-wired to my router/cable modem and two separate network names, which the devices were always getting confused by. Now it's the same network, good signal strength throughout the house, seamless operation, and easy setup and monitoring. The guest network is a breeze and super easy to activate/deactivate and connect someone to using a QR code. The units tend to run a little hot but they have a nice form factor. No regrets!
customer_reviews.author: AFdoc

customer_reviews.title: chuck your wifi rauter!
customer_reviews.text: i'm not a tech guy. our 3000 square office wifi from comcast kept dropping the signal making impossible to use work-related software, which requires a constantly strong signal - ironically wifi boosters were only splitting that signal making it even weaker, thus after long research, i narrowed down on the mesh system. this one (eero) - hands down - is the best out there. you can test or try other once, nevertheless, i've got the feeling that you will end up using eero at some point. we love it!
customer_reviews.author: mpk

customer_reviews.title: WiFi improved 200% A Must Have for any home!!
customer_reviews.text: We live in an older two story house with basement and had issues with buffering from our Netgear WiFi modem. I ordered these had all 3 units set up in about 20 minutes and now we have no buffering!! The best part is that all of our 2.4 GHz devices connected with no issues at all, and the eeros uses 5 GHz on devices that operate better on that frequency. Our current download speed is over 470 Mbps even with 16 devices connected. Would definitely recommend buying these even though they are a higher price and make sure to get the wall mount brackets as well.
customer_reviews.author: salyers88

customer_reviews.title: Great system for two-level houses!
customer_reviews.text: We have a two-level house and had a Netgear router with extenders. Not being a techie, I had problems with the network setup after adding a second extender. We had three different WiFi addresses and it was very confusing. I read about the eero system and decided to try it. Bought this one and added another beacon. It was very easy to install, other than finding out I didn’t need the new modem I purchased because the modem was built-in to my ISP system. We put the Eero router and one beacon upstairs and the other two downstairs. Our WiFi coverage is great and all works thru a single network name. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: John51

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding WIFI and a Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: First off, that installation experience, WOW. Less than 15 minutes to have all three EERO Pro setup and the network screaming along. The units are great looking well built and they truly deliver a whole home WIFI experience. These are the fastest speeds I have had in years and there are no more deadspots in the back of the house. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a solid long term WIFI solution.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Jay Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup. Very reliable and super easy to use.  I'd buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this set. I have now been using them for a month and I love them! My previous solution (Linksys) was unreliable, glitchy, hard to work on and over all just a pain in the keyster. The Eero is super easy to setup, has been extremely reliable and super easy to operate. I love the app interface. I've talked with several friends who I discovered use the Eero and they reported the same experience. I would buy these again in a heart beat. Just kicking myself for not doing it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Bradly J. Bechtel

customer_reviews.title: Great whole house WiFi at last!
customer_reviews.text: We were lazy and kept our AirPort Extreme for the last 4 years, not realizing it’s obsolete and that there was a better option. We could barely stream anything and our internet was always so slow and frustrating to our household. After reading several articles and reviews, decided to take the plunge on this system. The eero pro and two beacons were a breeze to set up and seem to do the trick on our 4500 square foot home. In some rooms the speeds increased 10 fold!. Can’t believe it took us so long to find this modern solution!
customer_reviews.author: I.M.

customer_reviews.title: Finally, great coverage and no flaky connections!
customer_reviews.text: We struggled to get decent WiFi coverage from the cable company provided modem/WiFi router... not to mention always having to re-boot the device when connections dropped for no apparent reason. I purchased my own cable modem (saving me the monthly rental fee) along with the eero system and have been a very happy camper since. When we built our new detached garage I purchased an add-on eero beacon and can now enjoy WiFi all around our property. Easy to set up and manage with the app and the only support I needed I found on the Web site which is very good for all levels of technical experience. Very nice system!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mesh system with easy to use app
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic mesh wifi system. It's been working perfectly for us. Packaging - absolutely fantastic! There's only one company in the world that I think does a brilliant job with packaging and makes it look beautiful and easy to unpack - Apple. This company did the exact same thing with their packaging and I love it. Beautifully packed in the box and easy to remove. Setup - soooo easy with the app. The app guides you through everything and it was so quick. I was able to do it in my son's room while he was sleeping (it's centrally located and where we put the modem) App - clean UI. easy to use and navigate. Great user experience
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Desai

customer_reviews.title: came back for the 2nd gen
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 1st gen one as a beta user and now came back for the second gen. I tested both out before combining the units as one network. The second gen does seem a little bit faster but not by much. However, I am assured that the third attenna makes a difference. I guess. Other than that, they seem the same.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hii

product_meta.title: Amazon eero Pro mesh WiFi system - 3-Pack
feature_bullets: Whole-home WiFi system - The Amazon eero Pro mesh WiFi system (3 eero Pros) replaces the traditional WiFi router, WiFi extender, and internet booster by covering a 5+ bedroom home with fast and reliable internet powered by a mesh network.

eero 2nd generation - With the most intelligent mesh WiFi technology and powerful hardware, the eero 2nd generation WiFi system is 2x as fast as the original eero WiFi. Backwards compatible with 1st generation eero products.
Cutting edge home WiFi - Unlike the common internet routers and wireless access points, eero automatically updates once a month, always keeping your home WiFi system on the cutting edge.

Mesh network - Powered by proprietary TrueMesh technology, the eero mesh WiFi network leverages multiple wireless access points to create an incredibly dependable internet experience, all on a single mesh WiFi system.

Quick & easy setup - Replacing your old WiFi router has never been easier than with the eero Pro mesh WiFi System. Setup takes minutes and the companion mobile app makes managing your home WiFi simple and intuitive.
